item.title: Problem with crafting
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

Well the textscripting is for interfaces only. I use it for skill messages, and quests, as well as for spells. It probably works for other things. Skillhandler.java is something that I found awile back (not sure where) and fixed it up to work with my serverbase, and that symbol for all I know is localized to that .java. You should go check out the make your own skill tutorial.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with crafting
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

deleteItem(1741, getItemSlot(1741), 1);

I suggest changing that 1 variable to a 2, but then again I use a different string for my server. well not too different just slightly.

skillhandler.delitem(1741, itemslot(1741), 2);

Is how it would look in my client.java.

It’s kinda like they have interchangable parts, either string can work for mine, I choose the latter because it rarely causes any errors, with conflicting code.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with crafting
item.dc:creator: @2hnderspeckr 2hnderspeckr
item.description:
@2hnderspeckr wrote:

Im making my own crafting skill, and ive add this code:

case 33205:
if(playerHasItemAmount(1734, 2) && playerLevel[12] >= 9) {
RemoveAllWindows();
addItem(1167, 1);
deleteItem(1734, getItemSlot(1734), 2);
deleteItem(1741, getItemSlot(1741), 1);
addSkillXP(320, 12);
sendMessage("You sew a leather cowl");
} else {
sendMessage("You need 2 thread and 1 piece of soft leather to make this!");
}
break;

when i make my leather cowl, it only removes one of my soft leather pieces

what should i do

Read full topic
